result.reason: This is a release infrastructure/website request to publish SHA checksums on the downloads page — not an application code change; our fork already uses GitHub Releases which provide checksums natively, and code signing via SignPath provides stronger integrity guarantees than file hashes.
result.approach: No code changes needed. GitHub Releases already show SHA256 for each asset. Our SignPath code signing policy provides cryptographic integrity verification superior to manual hash checking. For the upstream project's website (mremoteng.org), this would require changes to their web infrastructure which is outside our scope.

attempts.raw_output:
This is a request to publish SHA checksums alongside release downloads so users can verify file integrity. It's a website/release infrastructure task, not an application code change.
